requirement.topic: Published messages in PtP mode can be queued by xmlBlaster if the receiver is not logged in

description.p: If you publish a message in PtP mode and the receiver is not online, you get an exception by default.
If the forceQueuing attribute is set in the publishing qos, the messages are queued by xmlBlaster. As soon as the receiver logs in, all queued messages are flushed to the recevier.
NOTE 1: The qualifier attributes from 'engine.qos.subscribe.OfflineQueuing' may be appropriate here as well (should we rename this tag to <OfflineQueing> as well?)
NOTE 2: The login qos may disallow PtP messages, ForceQueing will be ignored then.

requirement.example:
<-- Publish QoS to send a message to 'joe' -->
<qos> <destination queryType='EXACT' forceQueuing='true'> joe </destination> <!-- Default is no queuing --> </qos>
requirement.author: xmlBlaster@marcelruff.info
